result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter Joseph Schoenauer

2022CM000027, 2022CM000070, 2022CM000096, 2022CM000098 & 22CM95 tracking together:

22CM95, 22CM96 & 22CM98:
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaints in all 3 matters & waives their reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties in all 3 matters.  Defendant understands. 
Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant in all 3 cases.

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant in all 3 cases

11:02 AM Defendant Peter Joseph Schoenauer appeared by phone.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Peter Joseph Schoenauer.  Attorney Cliff Burdon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Dolch states that the matter is resolved but asks for this to be reset with Atty Gumz.  Atty Dolch states that there is a new case for the defendant and asks that the cases track together.  Court will handle the initial appearance on the new case now.  Defendant has not received the complaint yet as he is moving.  Court confirms address.  

22CM70:
Atty Dolch received a copy of the criminal complaint on behalf of her client & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant on 22CM70.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions on 22CM70:
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
*Appear for booking within 30 days to the Marquette County Jail 
**Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days 

Court will set both cases for a status by zoom
Status hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:31 PM Defendant Peter Joseph Schoenauer appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Rachel Roberge appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Atty Roberge states that the defendant does qualify for Public Defender.  
Court signed a probable cause statement.

Atty Burdon requests a $100 cash bond with conditions.
  Court confirms address and phone.  Defendant is on probation at this time.
Atty Roberge requests a signature bond and makes arguments. 

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:  Initial appearance scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
